newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Two Turks freed on murder charge in Malaysia.
newsitem.headline: Two Turks freed on murder charge in Malaysia.

text.p: A Malaysian high court on Saturday acquitted two Turks of a charge of murdering a former member of the Canadian Air Force, the national Bernama news agency reported.
Justice Pajan Singh Gill directed a seven-member jury to return a verdict of not gulity on Olmez Orhan and Kocaslan Hidayet without their defence being called.
Orhan, 40, and Hidayet, 28, were jointly charged with the murder of John Gatley, 68, in central Cameron Highlands between February 10 and 11, 1994.
"The prosecution has no doubt proved that Gatley was murdered but has not linked the two to the death of the deceased," Gill said.
"Suspicion however strong cannot be substituted as direct evidence and is insufficient to prove that they caused the death of Gatley," he said.
